text:
Richard B. Hull, Executive Director
Mr. Harold Hill, Vice President
National Association of Educational
Broadcasters
19 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Harold:
Enclosed for the record is a copy of a proxy from
Bob Lacy at Oklahoma. Also enclosed is another proxy
from Frank L. Knorr, Director of Radio at Haverford
Township. This latter together with a note I cannot
find, represents a double proxy. Burdick had to leave
early and gave me this one which he signed over on his
own in case there was an issue in the negotiation debate
on network transfer.
I thought the convention was one of the best I have every
attended if not the best and I want to congratulate you
for your part in it.
Incidentally, I can see why you were happy to have someone
carry the exhibit. I managed to get it home without knocking
a hole either in the plane or the exhibit but it took some
doing. Thanks very much for letting me have it. It will be
a help in our NCA TV conference coming up here in November.
Best wishes.
RBH:df
Enclosure
Sincerely,
Richard B. Hull, Director
Teaching Aids Laboratory • Office of Seminars and Workshops • Ohio School of the Air • Video Recording • WOSU—WOSU-FM—WOSU-TV • Closed Circuit TV
